intro: Nicotiana glauca f. lateritia, commonly known as the silverleaf tobacco, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. This variant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, pubescent hairs. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
